info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 19 at 2:40AM CDT until September 20 at 4:21AM CDT by NWS Aberdeen SD
info.description:
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in South Dakota...
Bad River near Fort Pierre affecting Stanley County.
.For sites with a river forecast, the forecast includes precipitation through the next 24 hours. Any future precipitation could affect the forecasts.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Bad River near Fort Pierre.
* WHEN...Until late tonight.
* IMPACTS...At 21.0 feet, Bad River Road begins flooding about 7 miles upstream of the gauge. At 24.0 feet, water reaches mobile homes along Highway 83 south of Fort Pierre.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:30 AM CDT Friday /1:30 AM MDT Friday/ the stage was 23.8 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 2:30 AM CDT Friday /1:30 AM MDT Friday/ was 24.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this evening and continue falling to 8.4 feet Tuesday evening. - Flood stage is 21.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/abr.
The next statement will be issued by this evening at 700 PM CDT /600 PM MDT/.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TONIGHT
